Recap: Gus and Harley talk in the car about his decision to go back to work. Jeffery and Buzz talk about a necklace and Ava. Jeffery tells Buzz to butt out. Dinah and Ashlee have it out. Ashlee thinks Dinah needs her for the tv station. Dinah says she is not that desperate. Malet and Marina have some fun kidding each other at the police station. Jeffery and Olivia meet again. Buzz goes to Olivia's to finish unfinished business, but she is not there. Jeffery meets up with Harley. It starts out as a shouting match ends in Harley asking for a deal. Gus and Rick meet. Gus then meets up with some guy from the Bureau. Camera crew visits the SPD and Marina and Malet are the subjects. Dinah runs into Gus and talks to him (Not sure what about). Jeffery, Harley and Dinah have a discussion, Jeffery and Harley leave. Buzz cleans up and Dinah catches him. Dinah wants Buzz on her tv show to talk about relationships. Buzz leaves Olivia a note about helping her to move on with her life. Harley wants Jeffery to help Gus with some gov't stuff. Gus meets up with Williams, a gov't agent. Then Gus phones a doctor. Gus gets bad news Ashlee meets up with Dinah. And Dinah agrees to hire her. Dinah want news of what is going on in Springfield. Mallet and Marina are still being followed. Mallet cuffs someone on camera. Olivia meets up with Buzz and he gives her a kiss that would curl your hair. Mallet and Maria meet up with Dinah and Marina tells her of the arrest Mallet made on tv. Gus' news is that he will never father a child. Gus lies to Harley saying he is never better.
Transcript: Mallet: So this isn't going to become like a habit, is it?
Dinah: Driving you to work every day?
Mallet: Yeah, it's just some of the guys might think I'm a... little bit of a puppy dog.
Dinah: Oh honey you are, I'm kidding, come on. Admit it, you know you can't get enough of me.

Mallet: Well, that's kind of true. I was wondering if you sticking so close to me lately doesn't have anything to do with maybe me being in competition with you over that last spot on the TV schedule?
Dinah: You are something else. You are so cynical. Why don't you try trusting me for once?
Mallet: Trust, right, right. Like you?
Dinah: Look, I'm trying.
Mia: Anything interesting going on here Detective?
Mallet: Look, my camera crew is here. So we're up and rolling, boys. Are we missing a light?
Mia: Dinah, are you going for another ride along?

Dinah: No. No, not today. I'm going to let the big man handle that. You know, I don't want to steal that spotlight from him. I need to focus on getting my own show clicking. "Light On Springfield," check your local listings.
Mia: You two are competing for the same time slot, right? Is that going to cause any tension at home?
Dinah: Well, we believe in releasing all of out tensions at home, but we support each other 100%.
Mallet: 110%.
Dinah: 120%.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: And I've get the concierge coming in for a refresher course on how to greet guests at the front desk. Then we're changing out all the beds in all the rooms, and then Emma's got...
Buzz: Honey, I would have thought you would have given this back to Jeffrey.
Olivia: Well, I was, I just haven't gotten around to it.
Buzz: Why don't I do it so you don't have to deal with it?
Olivia: Yeah. Okay. Good, because I just... I want him out of my head, out of my sight.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Jeffrey: Well, what are you talking about? Clayton is the perfect town. Well, why not? Why can't you. Yeah, but... yeah, I... yeah, but... would you shut up and listen to me? No, that wasn't very professional. I'm sorry. I'm just trying to tell you that I will take any job, ok I will work my way up, I will...Yeah, I understand.
Bartender: Want me to get another bottle?
Jeffrey: I'm not going anywhere. ( Cell phone rings ) I haven't heard that in a while.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: What did she used to look like?
Gus: I don't... I don't... I don't know.
Harley: Better or worse?
Gus: I don't know. I don't remember.
Harley: How come you don't talk about your exes?
Gus: There is not really the talk... I don't have any to talk about.
Harley: Except for Bailey Brook.
Gus: Oh, geez. It was nothing. It was really nothing.
Harley: Not according to Blake.
Gus: Blake. Blake and all of her little secrets.
Harley: You're not worried about this at all?
Gus: Honey, when I was an agent, I did so many things that were technically secrets, you know?
Harley: Well, were any of them ugly?

Gus: What do you mean? Something that could mess us up? No. No. What is the matter with you? You want it to be a big mystery? Your life is boring? You want to amp it up? What, you want to go on the run again? You want to be on the lamb?
Harley: Okay.
Gus: Yeah?
Harley: Yes. After we make a baby.
Gus: Well, no.
Harley: That'll be us.
Gus: Thank you, no.
Harley: Pregnant and on the run? It'll be fun.
Gus: Not so much, I don't think so.
Harley: If you're not worried, I'm not worried. I'll let it go.
Gus: Yeah? Sounds good to me.
Harley: I'll get the kids.

Gus: Yeah, it's Aitoro again. Listen, I need that information about my history, okay? So you need to meet me now. No, you meet me now or I'm going to find a messy way to get into my file, and it won't be pretty.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gus: Hmmm.
Harley: See that kid. He's way too big to play baby Jesus. He should be Santa Claus.
Zach: His mom complained to the principal. She was going to sue.
Harley: Really? Did you hear that? A lawsuit. Are you okay?
Gus: Yeah. What?
Harley: Well, tell me how much you hate lawyers.
Gus: I am a lawyer. Listen, I've got to run an errand 'cause there's this thing I got to do to wrap up a case, so...
Harley: That's okay because I've got to get them to soccer-- here, take this-- and I've got to get to the station house. So can I meet you for dinner later?
Gus: Yeah. Bye guys.
Zach: Bye.
Harley: Bye.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: What you doing sweetheart?
Mallet: Well, the normal stuff that we do to catch the criminal, laying the ground work, so to speak.
Dinah: You mean paperwork. What's the crime? Illegal cable hookups? Loitering. You know, I would sit up at nights and I'd worry about you running into gun battles on Main Street.
Mallet: Well, we don't se too much of that stuff all the time.
Dinah: That's right, 'cause you're filling out forms.

Mallet: Except for that part, if you remember correctly, where I almost got shot or that part where I almost died in a fire. That's pretty exciting stuff. I mean, it's not gossip exciting, but it is exciting.
Dinah: Gossip. Well, I don't do gossip. I do infotainment. "Light On Springfield" is the name of the show.
Mallet: Honey, thank you so much for stopping by.
Dinah: Infotainment is fun and it's informative, and it's "Light On Springfield." You need to check your local listings.
Mia: Yeah, I don't think we're going to use that.

Mallet: Sweetie, you have a great, fun day today working on your show, okay? You know, the flower arranging, the guest from the local animal parks and whatnot. Me, I'll be here. I'll be hitting the streets, doing what I have to do to put the bad guys where they belong...In the slammer.
Dinah: Pushing papers.
Mallet: You. You. Break a leg.
Dinah: Okay. Bye.

Olivia: What is it with you?
Buzz: I don't know, what is it with me?
Olivia: Me. No, every time I'm with you-- it's a good joke-- I just feel safe when I'm around you. Almost makes me forget all of the bad stuff.
Buzz: Almost? Well, that's... my job is to make it all disappear.
Olivia: Oh, you're setting yourself up for disaster.
Buzz: We'll see.
Olivia: What do you mean we'll see?
Buzz: I have not yet begun the fight.
Olivia: What are you talking about fight? What fight?
Buzz: Alan, I can't compare with Alan, I mean, with his resources and his cash, but I do have conviction. And I have an overwhelming desire for you. ( Laughter ) I'm off.

Olivia: Be careful out there, my hero. ( Phone ringing ) Olivia Spencer, oh you know, if he's going to be late, then we'll have to reschedule. Could you send up the proposal from the new florist? Great, thank you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: What can I get for you today? The usual? The special is hazelnut latte.
Jeffrey: Okay, okay. Cut to the chase. You called, I'm here what do you want?
Buzz: Here. From Olivia. Take it and everything that goes with it.
Jeffrey: What's that supposed to mean?
Buzz: It means I want you to leave. Do Olivia, do Ava, do Springfield a favor and leave town, and now would not be soon enough.
Jeffrey: I don't think so.
Buzz: Jeffrey, I know where you are. I know what it's like to wake up and find out you have a child you didn't know you had and she's all grown up. You missed everything.
Jeffrey: Well, you know what? We'll have to share a beer and have a good cry some time. But until then...

Buzz: Hey, Ava doesn't deserve this. Think about it. She's got her life together. You pulled the rug out from under her. She's on her butt, she doesn't know who she is. She finds out she has two parents that are pretty complicated people. She needs time to recover.
Jeffrey: Well, I'm not part of Ava's life-- not now, not ever. I made that clear to Olivia.
Buzz: You're right. Ava isn't my business, but Olivia on the other hand...
Jeffrey: Oh, "Stay away from my girlfriend"? Is that what this is?

Buzz: There's no point to you lurking around here. You have no jobs, you have no prospects, and all you remind her of is something she wants to forget, okay? So pick up your things and move on. Learn from mistakes and start fresh.
Jeffrey: Buzz, you should stick to making coffee, because you make a lousy life coach.
Buzz: I don't really care what you do with your life, just do it somewhere else.
Jeffrey: You can tell Olivia I'm sorry that we have to share the same planet.
Buzz: Sharing the planet is not the problem. Sharing this town is. Stay the hell away from her. You get that?
Jeffrey: Yeah, I get it, Buzz, but I can't make that promise.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: Excellent, excellent. Ladies and gentlemen, here comes Dinah Marler, the one and only...
Ashlee: I came up with that slogan.
Dinah: Well, it doesn't look half bad. It's quite clever, but too bad it's gonna tank, you might need a job pretty soon.
Ashlee: But it's a hit.
Dinah: "Light On Springfield," is going to bump that hit.
Ashlee: Gossip, right?
Dinah: Infotainment!
Ashlee: Oh, cool. Well, maybe you could use me. I could work for you. Someone to help out?
Dinah: Well, you know, I'm good, I'm good.
Ashlee: Well, I don't see that much production stuff happening?
Dinah: Well, so we're ramping up is what you're seeing.
Ashlee: Maybe you need an insider, like someone who can give you the scoops?
Dinah: Someone like you?
Ashlee: Well, yeah, I have loads of experience.
Dinah: Okay. Like what?
Ashlee: Well, I helped Blake Marler for one.
Dinah: Let me tell you something sweetie, okay? "Springfield Burns" that on your resume, that's a dealbreaker for most people in this town.
Ashlee: Including you?
Dinah: I haven't decided yet.
Ashlee: You don't have anything to put on the air, do you? You need me.
Dinah: Oh, stop suggesting I'm that desperate.
Ashlee: Or that jealous.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Mallet: So I want to ask you, this show that Dinah's working on, you don't think it really stands a chance up against our show, do you? I mean, I would be very happy, you know, if her show blew up and became a big success.
Mia: Well, yes, she's a great personality. The cameras love her.
Marina: No one told me there was going to be a camera crew here today. Hey, boss. Looking good. A.C. Mallet is "The Law.
Mallet: You love doing that, don't you?
Marina: Doing what? Saying "The Law.
Mallet: Please, tell me... just please tell me someone got killed.
Marina: What?

Mallet: No, I mean... I didn't mean it like that. I didn't... what I'm trying to say is please tell me that you've got a case. Any case, anything will do, like a robbery or a homicide, that would be really nice.
Marina: Now see, most cops like it when there is not crime.
Mallet: I do, I do like that. But I've got a reality show and there's no frickin' crime in this town today.
Marina: Oh, don't you hate it when we do our job. So this crew, they're going to follow us around on our shift, no matter what we do, where we go, it will end up on the show?
Mallet: Yeah. Do you have a problem with that, Detective Cooper? Because the thing is, being my partner, you kind of end up being a character on my show.
Marina: Your show?
Mallet: You might be a little nervous, but just act natural. And remember we are tough, gritty, working class cops just doing what we do.
Marina: I can totally do that. It's perfectly normal. Hey, partner.
Mallet: Hey.
Marina: So you catch any cases yet?
Mallet: No, no, not yet.
Marina: Well, then, let's go catch us some bad guys. Policeman, policeman we're putting away bad guys.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: You know, I know what it is like to try to live down a mistake. Do you know what it takes to do that?
Jeffrey: I think you're going to tell me.

Buzz: It takes sacrifice. The cleansing fire of sacrifice. You know what sacrifice you're going to have to make? Now, today, you're going to go over to Olivia's hotel, and you're going to move out and find another place to live.
Jeffrey: It's not gonna happen.
Buzz: You might want to rethink that.
Jeffrey: You know, you Springfield people are starting to piss me off. Keep your pie.
Buzz: It's cake, and the feeling is mutual.
Jeffrey: Yeah, yeah. Buzz, you're getting lucky with a pretty lady, and now you're trying to get all tough with her.
Buzz: You know, when you were young, you made a mistake, you did something really, really awful. But you're a man now and you're going to have to face it like a man.
Jeffrey: Keep your threats and take whatever medication you might need and get out of my face.
Buzz: Medication? What kind of crack is that, medication?
Jeffrey: You have a weak ticker, Buzz, and you're fragile.
Buzz: You sure about that?

Jeffrey: I have lived with what I did for long enough. I don't want to carry that burden anymore. All I want is some peace and maybe just a little bit of forgiveness if that's possible in this lifetime. And you know what I realized? Olivia is the key to all of that for me. Olivia is my way out of hell. Your salvation is not my problem, and it's not Olivia's.
Jeffrey: Bye, Buzz. Thanks for the coffee.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: Thanks.
Jeffrey: Things are going to get better for both of us, you know? And I'm going to do whatever it takes to win your forgiveness.
Young Jeffrey: You've always looked so good to me. What are you wasting your time here for? Why don't we go away, the two of us, in that room.
Olivia: That room...
Young Jeffrey: Think about it. You know me, you like me, you want me, you always have.
Olivia: Now you're the heart of all my pain. I can't stuff the memories in anymore places, there's no more room. It keeps pouring out of me all the time, choking my thoughts.
Jeffrey: Olivia.
Olivia: No, just one moment of peace, okay? Please, just leave me alone. Both of you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Knocking on the door )
Buzz: O'Neill open up! ( Knocking on the door ) O'Neill we have got unfinished business!

Harley: Hey, Jeffrey. Hey! No, wait, wait! I'll catch you.

Harley: What are you talking about?
Jeffrey: I just had a discussion with your dear old dad. He wants me to stay away from his girlfriend.
Harley: Why, are you interested in Olivia?
Jeffrey: No, I'm not interested in... he wants to erase her ugly past.
Harley: Yeah, I've been getting that from him. Why don't you steer clear?
Jeffrey: I'm trying... he thinks this town isn't big enough for the three of us. I'm waiting for him to challenge me to a duel.
Harley: You better watch out. My dad was in Nam.
Jeffrey: Terrific.
Harley: I'm not going to give you any heat, okay?
Jeffrey: Good.
Harley: Mainly because you're the only person who can help me.

Gus: Yeah, there's a couple of things I need to know.
Rick: Okay. Well, as soon as there's a change, I'll give you a call.
Gus: Great.
Rick: I got to go.
Gus: That's cool. Where are you? You found me.
Williams: It wasn't hard. How you doing, agent Aitoro?
Gus: Good.
Williams: I got some answers for a man asking the right questions.
Gus: All right. I wish you had had a smile on your face when you said that?

Ricky Paull Goldin, "Inside The Light." What does a woman need to win Ricky Paull's heart? She needs to have a job. ( Laughter ) That would be nice. For starters, that's all I'm saying. Mallet: A 10-11. A 10-11 is usually a barking dog.

Marina: Those are prescription.

Mallet: Uh huh. Would you prefer if we got you a stretch limo squad car for your next stakeout? Or would you prefer we put the stereo on top of the squad car and you play your theme song while you make a bust.
Marina: Yeah, nice, nice. You see, I'm not the one with my name in the title.
Mallet: Listen, this show is becoming a pain, okay? I don't want to do this show. Where are you going?
Marina: Just heard a rumor, want to see if it is true.
Mallet: That's my desk. What are you doing?
Marina: Oh, no. Moisturizer. ( Laughs )
Mallet: Mia said that I look a little clammy on camera, so...
Marina: Look at this. Wait, check it out. That's right, this hard-nosed cop has been practicing his autograph.

Dinah: Hello, ladies and gentlemen, my name is Dinah Marler. I want... wait, okay. One name, one name. Dinah. It's the Dinah show. Welcome, ladies and gentlemen. We have a great show for you. That's right.
Mallet: In a world where chaos reigns and the helpless scream in the night...
( Scream )

Mallet: ...One man stands as a beacon in your darkest hour. If you have a problem that no one can help, call the 23rd precinct. Me, A.C. Mallet, I'm bringing down the hammer of "The Law". Policeman, policeman we're putting away bad guys.

Gus: Dinah.
Dinah: Hi. Okay, I wanted you to think about something.
Gus: I'm just in the middle of a meeting.
Dinah: Oh, hi. Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt. Okay, give me a call when you can.
Gus: Yes, sure.
Dinah: Okay, don't forget.
Mallet: In a world where chaos reigns and the helpless scream in the night...
( Scream )
Dinah: How much commercial time did they buy?
Dinah: The street. Yeah, the street is where the action is. A million stories in the naked city. More stories than I can shake a TV show at. Hey, guys. What's the crisis?
Harley: We're just talking about something, Dinah.
Jeffrey: Well, she's talking. I'm listening, waiting for her to get to the point.
Harley: I was going to get to the point, but somebody walked up and I can't...
Dinah: Let me put something up the flagpole and see what you guys think. You know I've got a new show. "Light On Springfield." Now, I've got a few ideas. I'm thinking bringing it on the road...
Harley: You know what? I want to hear about this, but right now I need to talk to him about something important in private.
Dinah: Private? It's Main Street. What privacy do you have?
Harley: Give me five minutes. Sorry.
Dinah: I'd like your opinion. Hi. Who are you talking to?
Olivia: Why are you sneaking up on people?
Dinah: Oh, well, I didn't mean to sneak up on you. I'm sorry.
Olivia: What do you want?
Dinah: I wanted to offer you an opportunity...
Olivia: Yeah, no. Just leave me alone, okay?
Dinah: I'm taking the stairs. Buzz?
Buzz: No, no, no.
Dinah: Well, do you want to talk about it?
Buzz: Not now, Dinah.
Dinah: I'll tell you what. Whatever you did to Jeffrey, he probably deserved it. He's not in there, is he?
Buzz: No. I was just cleaning up.

Dinah: Well, if you ever want to talk about it, I know that you and I could, because I think that you and I are very similar. I think that we think outside the box, and we're passionate about people, and whatever you did in there, I've done ten times worse. I can guarantee you. I know that we can talk about it and we love the people we're involved with.
Buzz: Yeah.

Dinah: Yes. And you know what we also do? We stick our necks out for the people. We love them, we go the extra mile. And you know what? We can talk about that on my television show. We can talk about that at another time as well. You call me. I want you to know that Olivia is a very lucky woman to have you. You enjoy your day.
( Phone ringing )

Buzz: Hello. No, this isn't Mr. O'Neill. Mr. O'Neill is checking out. Can you get his bill ready? And tell him to leave something for the maid, okay? Thank you. "Just helping you move on in your life. Get going. Stay gone. Love Buzz. Jackass.

Olivia: Leave me alone, please. Please just leave me alone. I want a life. I have a chance to move on and be a whole person.
Young Jeffrey: With who, with Buzz?
Olivia: He loves me like no one has ever loved me. I want a life. I want Buzz, and Emma and I want you and Ava to just go away. Let me go.
Young Jeffrey: We're not going anywhere.
Olivia: I'm not dragging you with me forever.

Jeffrey: Well, could you hurry it up please. I'm feeling a little boxed in lately.
Harley: Okay. I need you. I need your government contacts to help me get into Gus' F.B.I. file so I can find out the secret Blake has on him.
Jeffrey: Harley I...

Harley: Before you say no to me, just listen. I want you to picture something, I want you to picture me standing on the cusp of my life. And on one side is all the years of crap that Gus and I have put up with, okay, years of this.
Jeffrey: And on the other side?
Harley: On the other side is me and him, free and clear of everything.
Jeffrey: So you're clearing the decks and taking all of the mistakes and regrets, and wrapping it all up...
Harley: And burning it. Burning it. Get it? So will you help me?
Jeffrey: Harley, you know that I would, but people aren't exactly taking my calls right now, and no one's calling me.
Harley: It's okay. Because I know it's not you. And things are tough for you, and I get that. And as a friend, can I say this? How did you let things get so bad?
Jeffrey: I guess I just didn't see it coming. Don't worry, Gus will find a way to get the information he needs on his own.
Harley: Well, he doesn't even know what it is he doesn't want to know.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Williams: I think I know what you're looking for.
Gus: Okay.
Williams: Remember that op on the cargo train in Missouri when you first joined?
Gus: It was a simple black bag job.
Williams: You were compromised. All of you were.
Gus: I was compromised.
Williams: Physically. You were exposed to a significant amount of chemical agent.
Gus: I'm fine.
Williams: Well, the symptoms can manifest in all kinds of ways. One loses his sight, one has vision problems, sterility.
Gus: Wait, wait, wait, wait. What... are you trying to say something to me?
Williams: No. How do you feel?
Gus: I feel fine.
Williams: Good. That means you're lucky. Get yourself a physical, monitor your health, and you're good to go.
Gus: I was wondering why my file was sealed.
Williams: It's the unknown that scares us the most. Good luck, Agent Aitoro.

Gus: Yeah, thanks. Hey, this is Gus Aitoro. A couple weeks ago I kind of blew off an appointment I had. I was wondering if I could get in there. As soon as possible. Yeah, I can come right now. Okay. Thanks.
( Telephone ringing )
Harley: Uh-huh.
Gus: Hey, Aitoro here.
Doctor: This is Dr. Lee at the fertility clinic.
Gus: Yeah, what's up, Doc. Got any news for me, tell me something good?
Doctor: We have discovered an issue of concern.
Gus: What?
Doctor: Well, there were some serious abnormalities-- problems with sperm motility and morphology.
Gus: In English, what are you saying?
Doctor: I don't believe you'll ever be able to father children.

Ashlee: There you are. Where have you been all day? I've been waiting.

Dinah: Yes, honest and truly.

Dinah: Good, good. Are they dirty?
Ashlee: Well yeah, but wait. Is the show more newsy or floozy? Because I feel like if we're above bored all the time, people are going to be snoozing and changing the channel and not be good.
Dinah: No, I think that we can go ahead and keep things, well, not above the board.

Mallet: The thing is, this guy's wanted in about seven states, so he might be a little jumpy.

Olivia: Hey.
Buzz: Hey. Wow!

Buzz: You want to go away?
Olivia: Huh?
Buzz: Just the two of us. Just the two of us go away...
Olivia: What about Emma?
Buzz: Jane can take care of Emma.
Olivia: I could use some grown up time away. I just need to forget about the world just a little bit. Please?
Buzz: That's what I do best.
Olivia: Thank you.
Buzz: You're welcome. I thought we might stay in the inn we stayed at the first night.
Olivia: You saved my life that first night.
Buzz: No, you saved my life.
Olivia: And you've been doing it ever since.
Buzz: You saved my life. This is going to sound stupid-- well, I know I am stupidbut am I just getting lucky?
Olivia: What?
Buzz: I mean with you. Is this...
Olivia: Oh, my gosh. Don't ever forget how much you mean to me, please. Let's disappear. Come on.

Mallet: Okay. Good job. Here's to good backup.
Marina: Oh.
Dinah: Hey. What'd I miss?
Marina: Don't worry about it. You will see it on the air soon enough.
Dinah: Okay, you guys got something for the air. Good, okay. Good.
Marina: Mal, I am going to let you now, I'm going to go get my nails done and then I'm heading to the shooting range. Later.
Mallet: Later, Marina.
Dinah: Mal? So what's the deal? You're the hunky detective and she's your spunky sidekick?
Mallet: So how is that little show of yours coming along, the little show that could?
Dinah: Yeah.
Mallet: Chugging along?
Dinah: Yeah, it's good. Little show's going to beat your show.
Mallet: Really?
Dinah: Yep, uh huh.
Mallet: It's going to be a big hit?
Dinah: Yes it is.
Mallet: No kidding.
Dinah: Yes, it's going to be a big hit.
Mallet: Wow.
Mallet: Now, is it just me or is the competition turning you on?
Mallet: I can't deny it.
Dinah: Well, I think all this fighting might be improving our relationship.
Mallet: It might be. It's kind of better than beating each other up.
Dinah: Yes.
Marina: Will you get a room?

Ashlee: Hey, here you go.
Mia: Thank you.
Ashlee: It's cool, you can cut the whole show on your laptop. Can I see a little?
Mia: Are they cute or what? A few cuts here and there and these two are going to be the hottest couple in Springfield.

Doctor: I don't believe you'll ever be able to father children.
